Description: Ostracon, small fragment of the body of a light-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is partially black in section, the interior is covered with a yellow-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and remains of two lines of Coptic text written in black ink, now faded.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393385) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393385)
